criteria.question: Participation of women and men in project identification

sub_criteria.question: Has the project consulted women and men on the problem or issue that the intervention must solve and on the development of the solution?
Have women’s inputs been considered in the design of the project?
Are both women and men seen as stakeholders, partners, or agents of change in the project design?

criteria.question: Collection of sex-disaggregated data and gender-related information prior to project design

sub_criteria.question: Has the project tapped sex-disaggregated data and gender- related information from secondary and primary sources at the project identification stage?
Does the project document include sex-disaggregated and gender information in the analysis of the development issue or problem?

criteria.question: Conduct of gender analysis and identification of gender issues

sub_criteria.question: Has a gender analysis been done to identify gender issues prior to project design?
Does the discussion of development issues in the project document include gender gaps that the project must address?

criteria.question: Gender equality goals, outcomes, and outputs

sub_criteria.question: Do project objectives explicitly refer to women and men? Do they target women’s agricultural production and marketing needs as well as men’s?

Does the project have gender equality outputs or outcomes? Examples are: Greater gender parity in the distribution of project resources (land, credit, technology, training opportunities), Increased participation of women and men in project activities, Improved representation of women in decision-making bodies created by the program or project

criteria.question: Matching of strategies with gender issues

sub_criteria.question: Do the strategies match the gender issues and gender equality goals identified?
Do the project activities build on women’s and men’s knowledge and skills?

name: Gender Analysis of the Designed Project

criteria.question: Gender analysis of the designed project

sub_criteria.question: Gender division of labor
Is the project addressing the array of women’s agricultural activities, including subsistence- and cash-crop activities?
Has the project considered how women and men fit their agricultural activities with other tasks in scheduling project activities?
Access to and control of agricultural resources
Will women and men have equal access to resources introduced by the project?
Will the project involve female extension officers or woman farmer leaders?
Will the training of agency/project personnel capacitate them for gender-responsive development?
Constraints
Has the project devised strategies to overcome constraints to project participation by women and men?
Has the project considered that constraints to women’s participation may require separate programming?

Does the project include gender equality targets and indicators for welfare, access, consciousness raising, participation, and control? Examples of gender differences that may be monitored: Adoption rates of agroforestry or resource management technology, Membership and leadership in farmers’ or fishers’ organizations or similar groups created by the project, Participation in training and similar project activities, by type of training or activity, Dispersal of project inputs (land, animals, seeds or planting materials, credit)
Does the proposed project monitoring framework or plan include the collection of sex-disaggregated data?
Is the budget allotted by the project sufficient for gender equality promotion or integration? OR, will the project tap counterpart funds from LGUs and other partners for its GAD efforts?

Does the project have the expertise to integrate GAD or to promote gender equality and women’s empowerment? OR, does the project commit itself to investing project staff time in building capacity for integrating GAD or promoting gender equality?

criteria.question: Relationship with the agency’s GAD efforts

sub_criteria.question: Will the project build on or strengthen the agency’s commitment to the advancement of women?
Does the project have an exit plan to ensure the sustainability of GAD efforts?
Will it build on the initiatives of other organizations in the area?
